Name: GRUB Legacy
Supported filesystem: FAT16, FAT32, MINIX fs, Linux ext2, ext3, ext4, ReiserFS, JFS, XFS, VSTa fs, Btrfs

Name: GRUB 2
Supported architecture: x86 (PC, UEFI, coreboot, OLPC, Mac), IA-64, ARM (U-Boot, UEFI), PowerPC (Mac, Pegasos II, IBM), MIPS, SPARC (SPARC v9), QEMU
Supported filesystem: ext2, ext3, ext4, btrfs, zfs, ufs, minix, iso9660, udf, jfs, hfs, hfs+, afs, affs, sfs, xfs, reiserfs, tar, cpio, NTFS, FAT16, FAT32

Name: LILO
Supported filesystem: indifferent{{Citation needed|reason=This claim needs a reliable source

Name: loader(8)
Supported architecture: x86 (PC, UEFI, coreboot, OLPC, Mac), ARM (U-Boot, UEFI), PowerPC, SPARC v9

Name: LOLO (Logic PD)
Supported architecture: ARM7, ARM9, ARM11, Cortex-A8, StrongARM, SH, ColdFire
Others: Supported devices: MCF54xx, MCF5329, MCF5373, LLH7A400, LLH7A404, LLH79520, LLH79524, LSH7727, LSH7750, LSH7760, PXA270, PXA320, IMX31, IMX27, OMAP35xx, OMAP37xx

Name: SYSLINUX
Supported filesystem: ext2, ext3, ext4, btrfs, ufs 1/2, FAT16, FAT32, iso9660, udf, NTFS (since 4.06), ?

Name: RedBoot
Supported architecture: ARM, ColdFire, H8300, x86, Freescale/Motorola 68000, MIPS, PPC, SH, SPARC, SPARCLite

Name: Das U-Boot
Supported architecture: PPC, ARM, AVR32, Blackfin, ColdFire, IXP, Leon2, m68k, MicroBlaze, MIPS, NIOS, NIOS2, PXA, x86, StrongARM, SH2, SH3, SH4, ...
Supported filesystem: FAT12(RO), FAT16, FAT32, VFAT, ext2, ext3, ext4, jffs2, cramfs, reiserfs, yaffs2, ubifs, nfs
Supported OS: 4_4bsd, Artos, Dell, Esix, FreeBSD, Irix, Linux, LynxOS, NCR, NetBSD, OpenBSD, pSOS, QNX, RTEMS, SCO, Solaris, SVR4, U-Boot, VXworks
Supported protocol: TFTP, NFS, serial (S-Record, Y-Modem, Kermit binary protocol)

Name: Barebox
Supported architecture: ARM, Blackfin, NIOS2, MIPS, x86, PPC
Supported filesystem: FAT, VFAT, ext2, ext3, ext4, bpkfs, cramfs, NFS, EFI, efivarfs, ubifs
Supported protocol: TFTP, NFS, serial (S-Record, Y-Modem, Kermit binary protocol)

Name: kboot
Supported filesystem: most supported by Linux Kernel (ext2, ext3, ext4, reiserfs, xfs, jfs, etc..)

Name: kexec-loader
Supported filesystem: most supported by Linux Kernel (ext2, ext3, ext4, reiserfs, xfs, jfs, etc..)

Name: Windows Boot Manager
Supported architecture: x86 (PC), ARM (only on Windows Mobile remake)

Name: FREELDR
Supported filesystem: ext2, FAT12, FAT16, FAT32, ISO, NTFS
Supported OS: ReactOS, Linux, Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows 2003

Name: Multiple Boot Manager
Supported OS: PC DOS, MS-DOS, Windows, OS/2, Linux, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, BeOS, B-right/V, Solaris, OpenStep, Plan 9, EOTA[6]
